newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Doctors certify HK protest leader Chan dead -- TV.
newsitem.headline: Doctors certify HK protest leader Chan dead -- TV.

text.p: Doctors have certified Hong Kong activist David Chan dead after he dived into the sea on Thursday in a protest over a group of disputed islands, Hong Kong's TVB television station and government radio said.
"A doctor just on board to check Chan's condition said Chan is certified dead," a TVB correspondent on board the protest ship Kien Hwa 2 said on HK TVB's news broadcast from the scene.
"The doctor has certified Chan has died. Everybody is extremely sad, thinking about the whole issue, some are crying and holding on to each other," the TVB correspondent said.
The reporter said the ship was now anchored very close to the islands in the East China Sea, which Japan calls the Senkakus and China knows as the Diaoyus.
The captain of the vessel had said that after the drama was over, he planned to sail to the Taiwan port of Keelung, the TV station said.
Chan was the leader of 18 protesters who sailed from Hong Kong last Sunday intending to remove a Japanese lighthouse and plant a Chinese flag on one of the islands, claiming them as Chinese.
